page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Holton Hall Holton Hallhas belonged to the Dixons and their family since 1741.Then the total of 700 acres was bought for Â£680.Additional land was purchased through the years and at one time amounted to 2800 acres,some of which was let.Today they farm 1400 acreswith a mixture of cereal,araable and parkland and they employ 9 men.There are 4 tenanted farms.In 1970 the whole village was owned by the family.We have sold 4 houses and we have sold 10 building plots to increase the size of the village.They still have about 55 houses to look after.It is interesting to note that in the early 1800's the estate was all farmed by the family,by 1900 it was all let to tenants and now more is being farmed by the family.This is a reflection of social and economic changes.
